meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh cry like a chicken.
meanings.sent1: The rooster will bawks loudly at dawn.
meanings.sent2: The chickens bawks when they see the farmer with food.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled when they heard the toy chicken bawks.
meanings.sent4: The alarm clock bawksed, waking me up abruptly.
meanings.sent5: The hen bawksed to warn her chicks of danger.

meanings.definition: A loud, harsh cry like a chicken.
meanings.sent1: The bawks of the hen echoed through the farm.
meanings.sent2: I heard a loud bawks coming from the coop.
meanings.sent3: The bawks of the chicken startled the cat.
meanings.sent4: The bawks of the rooster signaled the start of the day.
meanings.sent5: The bawks of the hen carried across the fields.

meanings.definition: To complain or protest loudly and forcefully.
meanings.sent1: He would always bawks about doing his chores.
meanings.sent2: The workers began to bawks about their long hours.
meanings.sent3: She would bawks whenever she had to eat vegetables.
meanings.sent4: The students bawksed against the new school rule.
meanings.sent5: The customers started to bawks about the poor service.
